comment: Very boring lectures but tests are straightforward. Open note, open book, no lockdown. Answers come straight from online book or her powerpoints. Few grades, major paper at the end of semester. You have to go to an art museum and write about any art you saw. Attendance mandatory, big part of grade. Overall, very easy class.

Can tell she is so passionate about art, but the class was boring. Since it was mandatory, I ended up losing some points. However, the assignments were planned well in advance, and pretty easy to follow. It's not a lot of work, but it was going to class that made me feel drained. I wanted to enjoy the class so bad, but just couldn't.

She's sweet but the class is boring. Not that many assignments mainly lectures, two critical thinking analysis (1-2 paragraphs), 3 tests (online no lockdown browser or webcam), museum paper, and extra credit. For the museum paper I recommend going to the High museum in Atlanta, every second Sunday of every month is free. Attendance is mandatory.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Super easy class, but extremely boring. Nice lady though who is passionate about art but there wasn't any engaging content/assignments. There were 3 papers which were pretty easy but she waits until the end of the semester to grade them. 3 tests that are online no lockdown. Attendance is mandatory, textbook is not but could help on assignments.
Professor Nicklas was very caring and sweet. Art is not a tough subject, so you should get an easy grade in the class. Test are open note as well. 10/10 would recommend.

Lectures are boring and skippable, just sign the attendance sheet. No lockdown browser or webcam for any assignment I finished the final paper in under 2 hours and got an A. Super easy A just do the work.

This class is easy, but so boring. I highly highly suggest you take it online because as a student who does not typically have trouble paying attention in class, this class makes me sleepy every time. She is passionate about the subject, but not about teaching, and its frustrating to not have any interaction in the class at all. Dont get textbook.
Very easy, whole course had like 3 tests and 3 papers, one large paper that took me a night to do, and for someone not good at writing papers, all of them got 100's. 100% recommend
Easy A, super easy. You can tell she loves what she does, attendance is taken and she's super nice.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: This is an easy A but a total sleeper class. She does take attendance so you have to show up but most people just work on other stuff during the lecture. She is passionate about the content though and will answer any questions you have. A couple easy assignments throughout the semester.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: She makes this class super easy and there's only like 2 or 3 assignments and tests. The only thing is that attendance is a bulk of your grade but I haven't payed attention in class all semester and have a very high A. She doesn't require lockdown browser for tests and the few assignments she assigns are super easy and took like 30 min max.

Easy A, very little workload which takes barely any time to complete. All assignments are very simple besides the final "paper", which will only take some time out of your day to visit a museum and talk about a piece of art.
Boring class, but nice teacher. Attendance is taken

Professor Nicklas was very chill . The assignment are very easy ( barely had any if im being honest ) . You have 3 test . 2 critical thinking responses and a Museum paper at the end . ALL of this was easy I got A's on everything including the paper and final . TAKE THIS CLASS . The work load isn't heavy at all !! If you want a EASY A . TAKE HER .

This was the easiest class I have ever taken at KSU but super boring. Your grade consists of 3 online tests (all on Quizlet), a museum paper, attendance, and 2 critical thinking responses. By far the museum paper was the most "difficult" thing. You also need to show up to class because she will take attendance every day. Overall great prof.

Boring, but VERY easy. No assignments but tests, can look up everything. Final is a museum paper, also easy. Attendance is mandatory, but its just useless lectures. The professor is so sweet & passionate, and will help you if you need. Take her

ATTENDENCE IS REQUIRED, and I have a mwf class with her. She is so nice, and I enjoy her lectures. She has a textbook, but tbh it isn't really needed. I didn't touch my all semester. She has easy assignments and tests are online without webcam. She even says herself the class is an easy a if you complete the assignments. I loved taking her class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The one thing that bothered me was that attendance was required but EVERYTHING was online, especially since this class is merely a requirement. The tests are open note (and on quizlet). She has a few assignments where you analyze art and stuff. Lastly, she makes you go to a museum and then write a paper about it.
This class was super easy. Very few assignments and the assignments are easy. take her !!

Prof. Nicklas is awesome! Take her even if you know nothing about art; I'm an art major and the concepts are generalized and easy to grasp. Writing is almost entirely opinion-based: 1 essay, 2 smaller papers, and weekly discussion posts. Instant 100s as long as you make an attempt. Tests are online, no LockDown, open notes (Quizlet is your friend!)

Professor Nicklas was nice and her class was very easy! I am better at writing papers than taking tests, so if you are the same way then I recommend this class. Attendance is mandatory but as long as you try to show up and write your papers and discussion posts, then you'll do great!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Take this class you don't even have to read the reviews haha just take it for the sake of your GPA.

tests not timed, & open book. She also gives you the study guide which is already filled in. discussions due each week but she doesnt read them & they are opinion based, no right or wrong answer. I maybe spend 30min on homework a week. ATTENDANCE IS MANDATORY. She says on the 1st day of class, she will give you an A, just turn in the work.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Attendance is mandatory, but all the class is is her reading slides that are pulled word-for-word from the textbook. She also flips through the slides so fast that you don't have time to take notes from them. But otherwise good, the only grades are the weekly discussions and a few papers.
She was nice, easy A.

Professor Nicklas is a wonderful professor. The class itself is pretty easy as grades are only participation (discussion posts), two written pieces, an essay, and three tests. Her guidelines are clear and she grades easy on the assignments. It was a freebie for this gen ed class, so take her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: I would take this professor again. There isn't a lot of work that goes into this class. There isn't a lot of work that goes into the class. There are weekly discussions and our tests are open notes which you can find quizlets with the answers.

search one question and the whole quizlet pops up on every single test&quiz. take her. easy A.i showed up to class 3 time total. she does take attendance on a sign sheet but I just marked myself as present for all the days..being present gives you extra credit. you have 1-2 paper but its like a paragraph not even a literal paper. got a 100% in here
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: All the work was online no lockdown. Few tests and a paper that was clearly outlined as to what to include. Easy A if you just do the work on time.

Very nice professor seems very passionate about art and I did find the information to be a bit interesting. The videos she would show in class were interesting, I did learn more about art and terms. The class is simple, the tests were simple and there are weekly discussion posts, extra credit, and a museum paper.

She's a sweet person and sips her water mid-sentence which cracks me up. Her class was an easy A and I really enjoyed going to the lecture just to listen. Discussion posts were easy, the museum paper was actually pretty fun, and the critical thinking responses weren't hard. She might also show you her art. Super easy class.

Honestly just take her if you want the easy A cant pass up on it. Also if you actually do end up attending class then it will be fairly boring if your not very interested in art however the grade is worth it

super easy and simple course! you had three test that were purely definition based, two short written responses, and a museum paper about a piece of art of your choosing where she gave a you step by step direction of what to include. participation consisted of doing a short discussion post every week. her class barely requires any work, an easy a
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: By far this class required barely any effort to make an A. The textbook is apparently required but I didnt opt out of it and ended up never touching the textbook. Hybrid class is just a discussion post every week which was easy and going to the class wasnt that necessary personally. You get an A as long as you do the work on time with some effort
Easy class! Prof Nicklas just makes you write a discussion post once a week and its not hard. Participate and get a good grade. You just have to share your opinion. Easy A!

Dr. Nicklas is so sweet and relaxed. Her class is very simple and she isn't a harsh grader at all. The textbook really isn't required because the slides have the same info on them. This class has been the easiest A for me so far. There are 2 critical responses, a final paper, and discussions weekly.

I took this class for an extra credit and it was the easiest class I've ever taken. Tests are easily found on Quizlet with no lockdown browser and the only other thing she grades on is weekly discussion posts.

Easiest A ever! There are 3 tests including the final which are all exteremly easy (answers found on quizlit). There are 2 critical thinking papers which are also easy and one muesem paper which takes a little time but its nothing too hard.

This was the absolute easiest class of my life. Close to no time consuming assignments. Theres a discussion video every week. Not hard at all. Test answers all on quizlet too. Theres a final museum paper that is time consuming, but she provides extra credit as well. If you want a class that requires almost no effort take this one.

Prof. Nicklas was super sweet and caring. She really seemed to understand that students must be going through a lot curing COVID, and made adjustments accordingly. Everything was open notes, we had one paper, easy classwork. This class was nice and laid back- a nice breather from the rest of my classes. Definitely take this class with Trina.

if you want credit for doing absolutely nothing except on test days, this is the most amazing class to take. had her for art in society-- would 100% recommend if you are a slacker or are just awful with time management. she is sweet and just doing her best to make covid easy for everyone, love her to bits. take this teacher.

This class is extremely easy to do well in. 5% of the grade comes from turning in a consent form. There is an optional assignment that can add 10 full points to your whole grade. She is very nice and clearly passionate about art. The lectures are actually pretty interesting, and the tests aren't bad if you review the study guides she makes.

The class overall was very easy. She does take attendance, but I'm pretty sure she never looked over it. She lectures the entire class and no one really pays attention. The only assignments for the class are 4 tests (all tests are on the study guide), 3 critical thinking papers (super easy), 1 museum paper, and discussion posts every week. Easy A!!

She was so easy. She did take attendance but she just lectures all class. You have three tests that are all 30 questions and she basically gives you the test on the study guides. Then you have to do a discussion post on two videos she posts every week and a critical thinking (3) here and there which are both easy A. You have one easy paper as well.

Professor Nicklas is a pretty good teacher. The class is not the most interesting and you will get bored, but if you can breathe you can pass the class. She posts the powerpoints and study guides that give you everything you will need for the exams. You'll need to go to class in order to get participation credit as you have to sign in.

This was an easy class but Im gonna have to give her a 3 because she flew through the power points and the study guides barely matched the tests. I pretty much got lucky for getting Bs on all of them because I felt like I didnt know anything. The critical thinkings and the museum paper really helped my grade a lot. Also, do the extra credit!

This professor wants you to succeed!!! Her tests were straight from the power point which made the tests extremely easy to study for her critical thinking response were extremely easy and counted a lot in her class she legit has an extra credit paper THAT GIVES YOU A WHOLE LETTER GRADE!!!!!!!! Take her for art in society in can't stress it enough

Her class was interesting and she's very easy to work with. You have four tests and a written response before the test but she grades easy and gives you the materials to do the work. The tests were a little bit hard but because it was a lot of memorizing who painted what and little details that I would forget about but still and easy class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She's super chill, plays a ton of videos in class. I listened to her lecture while doing other things and the material is simple to remember. The writing assignments are easy, I did them the day of and got 100 on all of them. One museum paper which is also easy, go to the museum on campus. Do not buy the book, you don't need it at all.

takes attendance everyday. she lectures everyday, SO BORING UNLESS YOU LOVE ART. i only took this class bc it was mandatory and i was bored out of my mind everyday. her powerpoints are like 100 slides each. discussion posts are simple and easy, tests are relatively simple if you study a little. it did not take a lot of work to get an A.

a GREAT class, took this class and expected another boring gened but i actually get excited to go to her class. she is an easy grader and and very understanding, the tests arent too bad and even if you dont to well with tests she assigns critical thinking assignments due the day of the test that help boost your grade. she does take attendance

Super chill, attendance is a grade, easy when you listen in lectures and her tests are not hard and not really from the book but more from lecture. Makes you remember the stuff you need to know for the test and is really helpful in test reviewing! Lectures are good but heavy bc its every day.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She gives a lot of points in writing and attendance so it evens out the tests grades. Her study guides are long and not clear whats on the test. She is passionate about what shes teaching and cares about her students. She takes attendance every day on a check list and turns it in at the end of every month.
